## VPS
  ssh
  
  `password`
  `12345`
  `1.2.3.4`IP
  `~/.profile``alias vps="/Users/Madordie/shell/Mac_shell/ss.sh"``source ~/.profile`
  
  
    - SSH`vps`
    - `vps /server_path /local_path`
  
  ```
  $ cat ~/shell/Mac_shell/ss.sh 
  
  #!/bin/bash

  echo 'password'
  port=12345
  ip=1.2.3.4
  usr=root

  if [ $# -eq 0 ]; then
      ssh $usr@$ip -p $port
  elif [ $# -eq 2 ]; then 
      scp -P $port $usr@$ip:$1 $2
  else
      echo "($*)"
  fi

  ```
  

# 
  

## CentOS

### git
  1. 
    ```
    yum install git
    ```

### go

  1. 
    ```
    wget https://storage.googleapis.com/golang/go1.7.3.linux-amd64.tar.gz
    ```
  2. 
    ```
    tar -zxf go1.7.3.linux-amd64.tar.gz -C /usr/local/
    ```
  3. 
     /etc/profile 
    ```
    export GOROOT=/usr/local/go 
    export GOBIN=$GOROOT/bin
    export GOPKG=$GOROOT/pkg/tool/linux_amd64 
    export GOARCH=amd64
    export GOOS=linux
    export GOPATH=/Golang
    export PATH=$PATH:$GOBIN:$GOPKG:$GOPATH/bin
    ```
    4. Linux
    ```
    source /etc/profile
    ```
  
## scp
  
  `scp -P 8888 root@127.0.0.10:/root/my_key/ca.cert.pem .`


## Ubuntu

### 
  ```
    sudo apt-get update
  ```

### git
  ```
  sudo apt-get install git  
  ```
### go
  ```
  sudo apt-get install golang
  ```

# SwiftNotification.userInfoFrameDebugRelease
  -->2016.12.1
  
  __ Version 8.1 (8B62) __

  ``` swift
    func keyboardShow(sender: Notification) {
        var endFrame = CGRect.zero        
        if let frame = sender.userInfo?[UIKeyboardFrameEndUserInfoKey] as? CGRect {
            endFrame = frame
            //  *** DebugRelease
            NSLog("<<<INFO>>>: as CGRect")
        } else if let value = sender.userInfo?[UIKeyboardFrameEndUserInfoKey] as? NSValue {
            endFrame = value.cgRectValue
            //  *** ReleaseNSValue
            NSLog("<<<INFO>>>: as NSValue")
        }

  ```

  ReleaseSwift`let frame = sender.userInfo?[UIKeyboardFrameEndUserInfoKey] as? CGRect`, ReleaseOC`let value = sender.userInfo?[UIKeyboardFrameEndUserInfoKey] as? NSValue`OCswift

  NSValueNSValueswiftCGRect..

  SwiftOC

This message will only appear once per execution. libc++abi.dylib: terminate_handler unexpectedly threw an exception ``` ## APP crash ``` [keyWindow addSubview:weakSelf]; ``` [](#) crash ``` [self.layer insertSublayer:xxxView.layer atIndex:0]; ``` ``` [self layoutIfNeeded]; [self.layer insertSublayer:xxxView.layer atIndex:0]; ``` > http://stackoverflow.com/questions/39565424/swift-uiviewreportbrokensuperviewchain-cause-by-layer-manipulation > > I had this issue with a library when moving over to Xcode 8 (Material-Controls-For-iOS - MDTextField). I found that the problem was coming from where the layer of one view (which had no superview) was being added to another. > > It looks like this may be the case for yourself also - your toolbar being created has not been added to a superview first. The fix I used was to add the view as a subview of the view that the layer was being added to, so in your case adding the toolbar as a subview of myModelView should stop the error. ## - [Google](http://technology.ezeenow.com/Posts/119474/Unity_Prime31_prompt_for_photo_is_crashing_on_iOS_10_and_XCode_8) - [IOS10View has lost track of its superview, most ()](http://www.th7.cn/Program/IOS/201609/975582.shtml) - [stackoverflow()](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/39565424/swift-uiviewreportbrokensuperviewchain-cause-by-layer-manipulation) ## <> ``` *** Assertion failure in void UIViewReportBrokenSuperviewChain(UIView *__strong, UIView *__strong, BOOL)(), /BuildRoot/Library/Caches/com.apple.xbs/Sources/UIKit/UIKit-3599.6.1/UIView.m:190 invalid mode 'kCFRunLoopCommonModes' provided to CFRunLoopRunSpecific - break on _CFRunLoopError_RunCalledWithInvalidMode to debug. UIView.m:190 - UIViewReportBrokenSuperviewChain

APP crash

crash



http://stackoverflow.com/questions/39565424/swift-uiviewreportbrokensuperviewchain-cause-by-layer-manipulation

I had this issue with a library when moving over to Xcode 8 (Material-Controls-For-iOS - MDTextField). I found that the problem was coming from where the layer of one view (which had no superview) was being added to another.

It looks like this may be the case for yourself also - your toolbar being created has not been added to a superview first. The fix I used was to add the view as a subview of the view that the layer was being added to, so in your case adding the toolbar as a subview of myModelView should stop the error.

http://stackoverflow.com/questions/39565424/swift-uiviewreportbrokensuperviewchain-cause-by-layer-manipulation

I had this issue with a library when moving over to Xcode 8 (Material-Controls-For-iOS - MDTextField). I found that the problem was coming from where the layer of one view (which had no superview) was being added to another.

It looks like this may be the case for yourself also - your toolbar being created has not been added to a superview first. The fix I used was to add the view as a subview of the view that the layer was being added to, so in your case adding the toolbar as a subview of myModelView should stop the error.

RAC

RACRAC

  • OCid xABSignalRAC

Swift

ReactiveCocoaREADME.md

Objective-C and Swift

Although ReactiveCocoa was started as an Objective-C framework, as of [version
3.0][CHANGELOG], all major feature development is concentrated on the [Swift API][].

RACs [Objective-C API][] and Swift API are entirely separate, but there is
a [bridge][Objective-C Bridging] to convert between the two. This
is mostly meant as a compatibility layer for older ReactiveCocoa projects, or to
use Cocoa extensions which havent been added to the Swift API yet.

The Objective-C API will continue to exist and be supported for the foreseeable
future, but it wont receive many improvements. For more information about using
this API, please consult our [legacy documentation][].

We highly recommend that all new projects use the Swift API.

```python
#!/usr/bin/env python
# -*- coding: utf-8 -*-
# @Author: LoveNight
# @Date:   2015-11-16 20:45:59
# @Last Modified by:   LoveNight
# @Last Modified time: 2015-11-18 18:07:19

# @Last Modified by:   Keith
# @Last Modified time: 2016-07-06 16:22:45
import os
import sys
import json
from bs4 import BeautifulSoup as BS
import requests
#import msvcrt

"""
hexo 

hexo
http://zhanzhang.baidu.com/linksubmit/index



python
pip install beautifulsoup4
pip install requests
xcode-select --install	
pip install lxml 

"""

#  URL
url = 'http://data.zz.baidu.com/urls?site=https://madordie.github.io&token=j33t0VEPFl24tJ8N'
baidu_sitemap = os.path.join(sys.path[0], 'public', 'baidusitemap.xml')
google_sitemap = os.path.join(sys.path[0], 'public', 'sitemap.xml')
sitemap = [baidu_sitemap, google_sitemap]

assert (os.path.exists(baidu_sitemap) or os.path.exists(
    google_sitemap)), ""


# 
def getUrls():
    urls = []
    for _ in sitemap:
        if os.path.exists(_):
            with open(_, "r") as f:
                xml = f.read()
        soup = BS(xml, "xml")
        tags = soup.find_all("loc")
        urls += [x.string for x in tags]
        if _ == baidu_sitemap:
            tags = soup.find_all("breadCrumb", url=True)
            urls += [x["url"] for x in tags]
    return urls


# POST
def postUrls(urls):
    urls = set(urls)  # 
    print(" %s " % len(urls))
    print(urls)
    data = "\n".join(urls)
    return requests.post(url, data=data).text


if __name__ == '__main__':

    urls = getUrls()
    result = postUrls(urls)
    print("")
    print(result)
#    msvcrt.getch()
```
